captions.text:
[ Duke Narrating ]
We were somewhere around
Barstow, on the edge of the desert...

when the drugs
began to take hold.

[ Duke ]
l remember saying something like:

l feel a bit lightheaded.
Maybe you should drive.
## [ Continues ]

- Hmm ?
- Suddenly there was
a terrible roar all around us...

and the sky was full of
what looked like huge bats...

- [ Bats Screeching ]
- all swooping and screeching
and diving around the car.

- And a voice was screaming:
- Holy Jesus, what are
these goddamned animals ?

- [ Grunting ]
- [ Rock Continues ]
# Come on, baby #

- Did you say something ?
- Hmm ?
Never mind.
lt's your turn to drive.

No point in mentioning
these bats, l thought.

The poor bastard'll
see them soon enough.

# Baby, l'm startin'
to feel human #

- # Ohh, ohh, yeah #
- # Hey, hey, Feel with me, baby #

- [ Grunting ]
- # 'Cause l feel it comin' on ##
## [ Continues ]

- [ Screeching Continues ]
- Fucking pigs ! Flying !
[ Grunting, Murmuring ]
We had two bags of grass...
75 pellets of mescaline...

five sheets of
high-powered blotter acid...

a salt shaker
half-full of cocaine...

a whole galaxy of multicolored
uppers, downers, screamers, laughers.

Also a quart of tequila,
a quart of rum, a case of beer...

- a pint of raw ether...
- Shit !
two dozen amyls.

Not that we needed all that
for the trip...

but once you get locked into
a serious drug collection...

the tendency is to push it
as far as you can.

The only thing that really
worried me was the ether.

There is nothing in the world
more helpless and irresponsible
and depraved...

than a man in the depths
of an ether binge...

and l knew we'd get into
that rotten stuff pretty soon.

[ Radio: Female Newscaster ]
A House subcommittee report
says illegal drugs killed...

160 American G.l.s
Iast year...
40 of them in Vietnam.

- [ Tuning ]
- # One toke over the line
Sweet Jesus #
One toke, man !

[ Singing Along With Radio,
Slightly Behind ]
# One toke over the line #

# Sittin' downtown
at a railway station #
# One toke over the line #

- One toke, you poor fool ?
- # Sweet, sweet Mary #

Wait'll you see
those goddamned bats, man.
# Mine #

comments.text:
Reminds me of why i did LSD once, and only once. I can handle some 
stimulants, weed, downers and even mushrooms...but Acid is a whole 
different ball park. ﻿
comments.author: Devin O'Mara

comments.text:
+daturave I think the toxicity thing is irrelevant since I've never dealt 
with that on either one. Well acid once but I mixed it with quite a few 
other drugs. The worst thing that's happened to me on shrooms is I feel a 
little nauseous but it always passes and doesn't even ever happen anymore 
actually.

I also had more experience with shrooms when I was young and care free and 
hardly knew what to expect so my happiest times were definitely on 
mushrooms. Mushrooms are what opened up me and my friends to this new 
psychedelic world. Not to mention I've gone much further and deeper on 
mushrooms than on acid. I'm sure you can go very deep on LSD I just don't 
have any experience with high doses so I couldn't tell you what happens 
then.

I had good times on LSD but I got my hands on it after I had already done 
shrooms dozens of times so it wasn't "too life changing" or shocking but it 
was still very profound. I think it's because when I got my hands on good 
acid was when I wasn't even a carefree kid anymore I was pretty much a 
young adult with shit to do so they had a different tone. I took acid at a 
strange place in my life. 

I totally understand why some people like acid better and think bad trips 
are more likely to happen on shrooms but for me that's just part of the fun 
I guess. They seem to be more unpredictable than acid and have a lot more 
tricks up their sleeves and I suppose this strange 'presence' like it has a 
mind of it's own and it's trying to tell you something. Terence McKenna 
says one of the differences between mushrooms and all other psychedelics is 
that mushrooms have a voice and it speaks. Mushrooms also seem to have this 
lighthearted emotional bias to them that just makes me so happy. Also on 
decent doses of mushrooms (especially at night) I get this 'coming home' 
feeling like this place that my soul immediately recognizes. It's beyond 
crazy and bizarre but it feels so comfortable and familiar like you've been 
there many times before. Not to mention this "place" feels very ancient and 
alien.
comments.author: Drawing Board

comments.text: +daturave I've had the complete opposite effects. Shrooms are my go-to.
comments.author: Jay Cee

comments.text:
+Drawing Board
Yes I guess i kind of agree, that is why I mentioned the set & 
setting/toxicity factor earlier. The fact is that I find acid a much easier 
substance as I stated earlier. Acid hits the spot, no extra fuzz. But there 
certainly exists the potential for bad trips with mushrooms if you are 
sensitive to toxins and don't have experience.  But I say this again, there 
is plenty of difference between different mushrooms, copelandia, one of my 
favorites, hits you (me) hard and is quite energetic .. on the neutral side 
I tend to get odd experiences of something touching my body which may 
interrupt your tripping for a sec. Although all the "confusing" (for me and 
all of who I know of) parts of the mushroom trips happens early on the 
trip, it certainly has a strange twist compared to acid. But yeah, they are 
quite closely related, and I guess there would be a potential to fail a 
"blind test",certainly if one is new to the game or haven't done it for a 
while.
comments.author: daturave

comments.text:
+daturave ya no FUCK acid lasts longer Einstein. I've tried many 
psychedelics and I do consider myself the connoisseur type when it comes to 
this stuff, other psychedelics I've had are not even comparable to acid or 
shrooms because they are completely different even though they also have 
psychedelic effects so I damn well know how to tell the difference. I'm not 
saying it just because they are both simply psychedelic come on now.

I'll admit they are not exactly the same and do have small differences but 
these differences are more qualitative than quantitative. In other words 
one does not produce more than the other when it comes to things like 
visuals. Sure the visuals are slightly different on some small levels but 
one is certainly not 'more visual than the other'. For me the main 
differences are mushrooms seem to be more sedative and emotional and LSD 
more stimulating. On LSD I also get more kaleidoscopic type visuals 
occasionally which I've never had on mushrooms and I also get time loops 
(time repeating itself) on LSD but never on shrooms. On LSD the colors also 
seem to be more runny and "liquidy" and on shrooms the colors seem more 
saturated. Differences like these yes but the effects are still near 
identical. The main difference is the head space but the head space of acid 
is not crazier than shrooms just a little different. On LSD i'd rather 
listen to Jimi Hendrix or The Beatles but on shrooms I'd rather listen to 
Jefferson Airplane or Led Zeppelin. Just different moods and tones. 

Even though they do have these various subtle differences they are still 
much MUCH more similar than they are different and the OP's comment makes 
no sense. There's no reason someone should be able to handle mushrooms fine 
yet consider acid "a whole different ball park." That's COMPLETE and utter 
bullshit they are both crazy as fuck. If you don't think shrooms are crazy 
as fuck just like acid you're getting ripped the fuck off!

Sorry but it just annoys the shit out of me when people say acid is crazier 
than shrooms, makes absolutely no sense. IMO nothing touches or comes close 
to the big three that being; DMT, LSD and Psilocybin Mushrooms. They all 
seem very high above everything else and they all feel very similar like 
they're all cracking to the same place. Even mescaline and the 2Cs don't 
compare on any level. There just must be a lot of people out there getting 
incredibly weak shrooms or something acid is not any crazier.
comments.author: Drawing Board

comments.text:
+Drawing Board
I think you are seriously mistaken and maybe lack experience. There 
definitely is difference between a sclerotia and copelandia. And even more 
so between mushrooms and acid. Yes, they are quite similar if you take in 
account all the possible substances you can ingest, they are psychedelics 
after all, but to a connoisseur the difference is clear ;). And acid trips 
last longer than psilocybin ones.
comments.author: daturave

comments.text:
I get the same effects from Mushrooms as I do from Acid......I think a lot 
of you are just getting bunk/weak shit.
comments.author: Drawing Board

comments.text:
+oneznzeroz Mushrooms just genuinely confused the shit out of me. I was at 
my buddy's college, visiting him. I walked ten feet off of his property at 
one point to grab a football we were playing catch with. I might as well 
have been in fucking Iceland. I had no idea how to get back. On acid, I am 
very aware of my surroundings.
comments.author: Richard G

comments.text:
+oneznzeroz  If you ever get a chance, do DMT. It helps you recognize the 
walls you put up against "love". Forces you to give in and once you do you 
get that, "haven't I been here before?", feeling.
comments.author: Jay Cee

comments.text:
+oneznzeroz Acid is easy because it's clinical and (excluding set and 
settings) always similar. I find it easier to handle. Now, with shrooms you 
have to keep in mind there are plenty of them that (although the main 
working ingredient is psilocybin) have a little bit different effects. 
Shrooms tend to make talking a bit more difficult in the beginning of the 
trip, but after peak no probs. But you also get used to shrooms eventually. 
Then there are the toxic effects that may adversely influence your trip. 
I'm quite sensitive to those nowadays, so i eat them with something calming 
for the stomach, and drink some water to ease in (one way,if you have 
plenty, is to make tea). If still feeling sick, puke once ;)
comments.author: daturave

comments.text:
+Jay Cee I wish that my brain was more comfortable with shrooms.   I would 
get so nervous during the climb, hitting peak had me wondering if I did too 
much but the come down was usually awesome.  I don't do anything synthetic 
today so haven't done LSD in a couple decades.

I watched this movie over and over again for five consecutive years. It was 
my one and only ambition in life to stay stoned as long as possible. The

those five years than I did at any other point in my life. Buy the ticket, 
take the ride.﻿

comments.text:

comments.author: CalKiteboarderkid

comments.text:
Agreed with Ken there, I grew up in the hellhole known as Victorville, CA 
and can tell you many of those scenes were filmed on the 58.  The I-15 is 
your direct route from LA to Vegas over the Cajon pass and through the 
'high desert' (there's a double connotation there), yet would have been a 
divided freeway at the time of filming.
comments.author: What's a name?

comments.text:
OK, looking at the footage, my guess it's either the US 395, north of 
Kramer Junction--south of KJ it's a bit more developed, but once you're 
north of US 58 you're in some truly magnificent desolation. It's not far 
from Barstow, but it's not on the Barstow-Vegas route (which is I-15).
comments.author: Ken Prescott

comments.text:
I probably worded my original question wrong. Forget the fake cactus, and 
forget they say "Barstow" in the film, as it has nothing to do with what 
location they use when filming. In the movie "The Shining", the hotel was 
supposedly in Colorado, but the hotel they used in making the film is in 
Oregon.

Now, back to the question.

Does anyone know where this actual scene from Fear and Loathing was filmed? 
What road?
comments.author: CalKiteboarderkid

comments.text:
hands down my favorite movie of all time. and I do mean that ALL TIME. 
there are dozens of quotes from this film that me and my buddies throw back 
and forth. never read the book im sure its wayyyy better then the movie but 
shit man watching two people take a drug adventure to the fucking limits is 
great and very entertaining to watch lol. in my opinion the best cult 
classic movie﻿

comments.text:
If you like the movie, you'll probably love the book. I also recommend 'The 
great shark hunt' for more HST adventures.

comments.author: Chris Santos

comments.text:
Ok. I’m envious with my brother. He has actually been single always and 
forever. Yet he caused a part-time model to state to him she is head over 
heels in love with him in under a thirty day period. Just how is that 
achievable? He explained to me he tried the Cupid Love System (Google it!) 
I wish someone attractive said that to me… I cannot recall at any time 
seeing him so positive. Kinda makes me feel bad.
comments.author: Vlatko Lav

comments.text:

Christmas, go rent it or buy it or watch it on Netflix or something!
